snippet: Ambitious changes to the automaker’s lineup and resolution of recalls and supply chain issues signal a recovery, the company says.
abstract: Toyota says ambitious changes to its car lineup and resolution of recalls and supply chain issues signal a recovery; firm regained its title as world's biggest automaker in 2012, selling record 9.7 million vehicles.

byline.original: By HIROKO TABUCHI and BILL VLASIC
byline.contributor: Hiroko Tabuchi reported from Tokyo and Bill Vlasic from Detroit.

lead_paragraph: Ambitious changes to the automaker’s lineup and resolution of recalls and supply chain issues signal a recovery, the company says.

headline.seo: Battered by Crises, Toyota Declares a Rebirth
headline.main: Battered by Expensive Crises, Toyota Declares a Rebirth
headline.print_headline: Battered by Expensive Crises, Toyota Declares a Rebirth
